title: What are the pros and cons of making an open application to Oxford or Cambridge?
text:
If you’re struggling to choose an Oxford or Cambridge college, here’s how to make an open application

There are more than 50 undergraduate colleges at Oxford and Cambridge from which to choose; I wouldn’t blame anyone for feeling a sense of panic. When I applied a few years ago, I had no one to ask about what each of the colleges was really like.

Each college’s prospectus says it is “open, welcoming and friendly”. But, having now studied at Oxford, I know that your college is where you’ll be spending the next three to four years of your university life. This choice actually does matter; it’s not a decision to make lightly.

After agonising over the choice, in the end I put my future in the hands of a computer programme, which randomly selected for me based on the course I was applying for — history — and the colleges that had relatively few applicants for history in 2014.

Do I regret it? No, I couldn’t have imagined loving Somerville, my chosen — or not chosen — college, any more than I did. Somerville genuinely was open, welcoming and friendly. You can even walk on the grass — not something that’s allowed everywhere.
description: If you’re struggling to choose an Oxford or Cambridge college, here’s how to make an open application
